column3: Already merged, but FWIW this is just as redundant. `secp256k1_ecdsa_recoverable_signature_serialize_compact` always returns 1; the serialization function semantics are that they never fail. No check is required.

> secp256k1_ecdsa_recoverable_signature_serialize_compact always returns 1; the serialization function semantics are that they never fail. No check is required.\n\nThat's trueâ€”however, as long as it has a return value, I think it's correct to check it. It might start to do error handling in the future.
